description: From Ancient Greek τετραπλᾶ (tetraplâ), neuter plural of τετραπλοῦς (tetraploûs, “fourfold”), from τετρα- (tetra-, “tetra-: four”) + -πλοος (-ploos, “-fold”).

entries.meaning: A text presented in four parallel versions, especially (historical) the version of the Bible presented in such a fashion by Origen.
